# Derivation

> Following inspiration from Kruschke (2011).

# From the definition of conditional probability: 

$P(A|B) = P(A,B) / P(B)$

$P(B|A) = P(A,B) / P(A)$

# Then: 

$P(A|B)P(B) = P(A,B)$

$P(B|A)P(A) = P(A,B)$

# Then:

$P(A|B)P(B) = P(B|A)P(A)$

# Then:

$P(A|B) = \frac{P(B|A)P(A)}{P(B)}$
